message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient’s warm, flushed, and dry skin, as well as dilated pupils, suggest anticholinergic toxicity. Among the options, urinary retention is a common symptom, while the other options are not typically associated with anticholinergic toxicity.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient is presenting with signs of anticholinergic toxicity, which can be caused by medications commonly used for seasonal allergies and asthma. Common symptoms include confusion, dilated pupils, and dry skin. Urinary retention is also a common finding due to the anticholinergic effects on the bladder. Coronary artery vasospasm and increased bronchial secretions are not typically associated with anticholinergic toxicity. QRS widening can be seen in severe cases but is not as common as urinary retention.

Urinary retention is a common symptom of anticholinergic toxicity. Coronary artery vasospasm, increased bronchial secretions, and QRS widening are not associated with anticholinergic toxicity.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms suggest anticholinergic toxicity, which is commonly caused by the use of antihistamines and tricyclic antidepressants. Among the options, only urinary retention is a symptom of anticholinergic toxicity. Coronary artery vasospasm and increased bronchial secretions are not associated with this toxicity, and QRS widening is more commonly seen in cardiac conduction abnormalities.

Coronary artery vasospasm and increased bronchial secretions are not typically associated with anticholinergic toxicity. QRS widening may be seen in some cases, but it is not as specific as urinary retention.
